result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert D Lathon III

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Robert D Lathon III appeared by video.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Robert D Lathon III.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties. Outstanding discovery issues put forth on the record. The State provides an update to the court regarding turning over necessary discovery. Court orders case adjourned for a status conference date to Br 16.
Status conference scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert D Lathon III in court in person.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Robert D Lathon III. Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court  in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Allis PD Officer M. Lazaris. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Robert D Lathon III in court.  Attorney Sarah Zwach appeared by video for Robert D Lathon III.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Preliminary hearing adjourned for cause to prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Signed and Filed.  nk
Received and Signed. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense

Defendant Robert D Lathon in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Calendar Call. Discussion with parties put forth on the record. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Zwach, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 by the completion of the case. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status Conference to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Calendar call on August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert D Lathon not in court.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Indigency Hearing. Defendant failing to appear, discussions put forth on the record. Court orders clerk to send written notice to the defendant via his last known address of record. Notice sent. Case adjourned for a Calendar Call to Br 16.  Calendar call scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert D Lathon in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case set for status. Mr Lathon is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel.  Defendant appears without counsel. Court orders the case adjourned for CAUSE for an Indigency Hearing.   
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case will be heard in room 503 of the courthouse.  Indigency hearing scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Robert D Lathon in court, appear in person.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Defendant is not eligible for SPD appointment of counsel and has not retained private counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Robert D Lathon in court with attorney Amanda M. Parent.  Defendant Robert D Lathon in custody.  Jacob A. Maule appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert D Lathon appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
